description:
The goal was to get the arms as long as possible (you can see some small galaxies at extremities ) 
and the possible detail in the arms
For this version ; I try to keep the natural aspect  (keeping saturation at a low level)
M74 finally looks like a small M101 


Wiki :
Messier 74 (also known as NGC 628 and Phantom Galaxy) is a spiral galaxy in the constellation Pisces. It is at a distance of about 32 million light-years away from Earth. The galaxy contains two clearly defined spiral arms and is therefore used as an archetypal example of a grand design spiral galaxy.  It is estimated that M74 is home to about 100 billion stars.


70 Light subs @180s gain zero and -15째C and

title: M74  Phantom galaxy -  another splendid Spiral - version  LRGB
